intro: Conyza prolialba var. subspicata, commonly known as whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its white to pale yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to North America, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in prairies, roadsides, and other sunny, dry environments.
